ygData.subject: RE: Getting my EQ fix any way I can (gee, this got real  long)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I completely agree that pets are useful for outdoor soloing. Very. But to have one to two spells per level that do little but allow us to solo outdoors ...
ygData.messageBody:
> No comment on the rest. I used my pet just teh other day to solo guards
> and such, not bad when you get him behind the mobs, double attacking for
> 11-18 and bashing to boot. Of course I was giving him decent (not
> rusty) weapons and always kept him behind them. So don't discount
> them yet. They are great outdoors for soloing, probably doing 200
> or so damage in combat. Not bad with Heat Blood and Engulfing going
> at the same time. Throw in a fear and a blue is dead with less than
> a bar of damage to you.

I completely agree that pets are useful for outdoor soloing. Very. But to
have one to two spells per level that do little but allow us to solo
outdoors ... well. Of course, I'm looking forward to voice graft a great
deal and a loss of pets would kill that but ... well ... I think I would
trade my pet for a damage shield every level. No ... I *would* trade my pet
for a damage shield every level or every other or so. At 30 our pet does,
you say, 11-18 damage plus bash. I'd trade that for 6 dmg damage shield that
is useable ALWAYS not just in outdoor soloing situations. I can see why
damage shields could be unbalancing however ... I just wish there was an
easy solution. Personally, I wouldn't care if troll and ogre SK's are better
than me because of that. I still enjoy to RP my human SK and I wouldn't
trade that for anything (cause I'd've been a wood elf druid if I cared!).

later,
back to work!
jer
